notes:
1. Minor Losses

Losses due to components like valves are called minor losses. They cause energy dissipation due to flow separation and turbulence.

The head loss is calculated using a loss coefficient, $K$:

$$ h_L = K \frac{v^2}{2g} $$

Values for $K$ are determined experimentally. A higher $K$ value means more flow resistance.

2. Valve Types

  • Gate Valve: Designed for on/off control. Low $K$ when fully open (minimal obstruction).
  • Globe Valve: Designed for throttling/regulating flow. High $K$ due to complex flow path.
  • Ball Valve: Quarter-turn valve. Very low $K$ when fully open.
  • Check Valve: Allows flow in only one direction.

solvedExamples.question: Which type of valve generally has the highest head loss coefficient (K) when fully open?
solvedExamples.explanation: Globe valves force the fluid to change direction significantly as it passes through the valve body (Z-pattern flow), resulting in high turbulence and high head loss compared to straight-through valves like gate or ball valves.
